column4: hey guys I have a little problem here: originally had ubuntu installed and decided to create a partition for windows. SO i resized my Ubuntu hard drive with the live cd and proceeded with installing Windows, but it looks like it got rid of the Grub. SO I cannot run Ubuntu now, it only loads WINdows. How do I fix this?
Have you tried booting off a live CD?
If you can see the linux partition from a live CD, there's hope.  If not, Windows probably ate it.  :(
ah ok... if it did see it what do I do?
In that case, you'll need to find a way to force a grub reinstall.  If you've got inet access from the livecd, sudo apt-get install --reinstall grub    should work
No guarantees, but theoretically, that should force the livecd to fix your boot system.  Can't say for sure, but the worst I'd predict would be a no-op.
I can hand you the usual magic formula for launching windows, it might work.
Certainly.
Take care, though, it's possible to screw things up if you edit the file wrong.
please please help :(
what was your solution?
Okay, step one is to figure out what /dev/hdX the windows partition is.
and how do I do that?
*nods*
Was about to direct you there, but that is... hiding in edgy.  O.o
For me, at least.  *glowers*
Okay, the one I've got is /dev/hda2, which maps to (hd0,1).  Assuming I understand the naming convention, that should make yours (sd0,1)
You can change the comment too, for clarity.  :)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/320/
Had to go put it up.  :)
The real "magic words" there are the root and chainloader line.  Root says "Use this file system", chainloader says, "And let it boot itself!"
Yup!
Good luck!
*smiles*  You're welcome, glad I could help.
